title: How will Reyna in Percy Jackson look like in real world? - Quora

response.answer_text: Honestly, this question can be answered by reading the books carefully. She’s been described in “The Son of Neptune” and a few more details along the way of the Heroes of Olympus series. She’d basically look exactly as she’s been described. There is an issue with a characters description in a book though. Everyone has their own exact image of how someone looks. There is always the similarities because of hard set limits in the book, of course. Everyone’s image of Reyna will have her have black hair, however, person a imagines her with short black hair while person b imagines her with black her that reaches to her mid back, as a simple example. Basically, what I’m trying to say is, there is no definite answer to how she’d look in real life, because her looks are variable per person. There are major similarities (like the hair example), but the specifics, which is what makes for an non-identical look, would be different for each person. Only uncle Rick would be able to tell us EXACTLY how she’d look, since he created her.

She’s described in The Son of Neptune as having “piercing black eyes” and “glossy black hair” worn in a braid. She is Puerto Rican and has a darker skin tone. Her height is never mentioned, but because she is always described as being “regal” and such, I’m guessing she’s on the taller side. She is seen throughout the series wearing a purple toga over golden armor decorated with medals.
